result.execSummary:
The defendant Xavier McFarland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 129 days time served.

miscConds.notes: Restitution in the amount of $811.50 to Eleanor B., payable during term of probation.  Restitution to be before any costs, surcharges and assessments.

Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment

Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job.
Obtain GED or HSED.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses.
No contact with Eleanor B., Jerrion J., Michael M., Deanthony P., Antonio C., Skye R., Keunana T and Antonio D.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Xavier McFarland
Current: 2419 N 44TH ST, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 02-07-2015)
Prior: 5839 N Teutonia Avenue #5, Milwaukee, WI 53209
Original GUILTY PLEA / SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (40 pages) commencing 06-11-2015 received and filed. CH

Defendant Xavier McFarland in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Xavier McFarland in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 3 1/2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 18 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 129 days time served.  Court STAYED sentence and placed the defendant on PROBATION for a period of 3 YEARS with the following conditions:
Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution in the amount of $811.50 to Eleanor B., payable during term of probation.  Restitution to be before any costs, surcharges and assessments
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be paid during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge during term of probation; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Obtain GED or HSED
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-No contact with Eleanor B., Jerrion J., Michael M., Deanthony P., Antonio C., Skye R., Keunana T and Antonio D. 
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances
-As a condition of probation, defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Corrections, straight time, no electronic monitoring

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Xavier McFarland not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Due to congested calendars, matter reset via telephone for June 4, 2015.  Later same afternoon, date given to State; but is unable to conduct the plea/sentencing on the June 4th date given previously.  Date found in which Attorney Dluzak is in this court on another matter.  Email sent to Attorney Dluzak notifying him that the date of June 4th does not work for the State and the matter has been reset for June 11, 2015 @ 8:30 a.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Xavier McFarland in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Xavier McFarland in custody.  
Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Plea colloquy commenced.  Based upon statements made by the defendant the Court will not accept guilty plea due to statement made by the defendant as to factual basis.  Defense requests time to confer with the defendant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
and Restitution Worksheet, received and filed.

Attorney Mark Allan Dluzak in court, defendant Xavier McFarland not in court, in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.
  Plea hearing scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Xavier McFarland in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Xavier McFarland in custody.  Benjamin Andrew Wesson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JERRION J. (2/8/00), MICHAEL M. (6/17/99), DEANTHONY P. (9/3/99), ANTONIO C. (11/16/98), SKYE R. (5/29/01), KEVIANANA T. (2/21/00), ANTONION D.; ELEANOR B. AND MAYFAIR MALL.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Xavier McFarland in court with attorney Mark Allan Dluzak.  Defendant Xavier McFarland in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
